Question: <txt>
When multiplying a real and complex number we can simply multiply both components of the complex number by the real number
<math>
p = 2+1i
<math>
n = 2
<math>
z = p cdot q
<math>
z = 2cdot(2 cdot 2)+(1 cdot 2)cdoti
<txt>
With the same logic we can multiply a complex number with another complex number with no real component
<math>
p = -2+2i
<math>
q = 4i
<math>
z = pcdotq
<math>
z = (-2cdot4i) + (2cdot4i)i
<txt>
Because i is the square root of -1:
<math>
icdoti = -1
<math>
z = -8i - 8
